paper_name: Mitochondrial ROS Drive Muscle Aging in Murine Models
Q1: Yes, quantitatively shown - Mitochondrial ROS levels correlate with frailty progression.
Q2: Mechanism supported by experiments - Excess ROS damages sarcomeric proteins and impairs muscle maintenance.
